reporting-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

title.narrative: ATA CLASS MATERIALS DHL&CUSTOMS FEES. Miscellaneous/Other Contractual Services - Other Contractual Services NOC (A, B, C) (ITA) (INS) (FAS)

description.narrative: Combat transnational terrorism, especially from al-Qa'ida, its affiliates, and adherents using a strategic counterterrorism approach that focuses on 1) countering violent extremism; 2) building the capacity of civilian law enforcement and criminal justice institutions to address threats within their own borders; and 3) building stronger relationships with our partners around the world – in order to engage in a broader, more comprehensive counterterrorism effort that treats civilian institutions, to include the justice sector and law enforcement, as a critical part of building effective partner capacity to counter terrorism.

This award strives to combat transnational terrorism, counter violent extremism, build the capacity of civilian law enforcement and criminal justice institutuions, and build stronger relationships with our partners around the world. This includes ATA CLASS MATERIALS DHL&CUSTOMS FEES[Covers miscellaneous contractual services such as A&E contracts and IT site preparation by the PBA, GSA, and commercial contracts, among other things.]. Fees[Covers miscellaneous contractual services not otherwise classified under Miscellaneous/Other Contractual Services.]. ATA CLASS MATERIALS DHL&CUSTOMS FEES[Covers miscellaneous contractual services not otherwise classified under Miscellaneous/Other Contractual Services.]. Fees ATA CLASS MATERIALS DHL&CUSTOMS FEES[Covers miscellaneous contractual services not otherwise classified under Miscellaneous/Other Contractual Services.].

participating-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

owner-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

description.narrative: The Government of Paraguay is making significant advances in fighting corruption and impunity and eradicating extreme poverty. Encouraged by a recently approved Freedom of Information Law and widely available public notices, citizens are denouncing irregularities and sending a clear message that corruption will not be tolerated. Although high levels of income inequality remain, Paraguayan government programs are producing positive results in reducing poverty and in countering illicit activities in the northern region. U.S. assistance programs add momentum to these positive developments, helping Paraguay strengthen its democratic institutions and supporting more equitable and environmentally sustainable economic growth.
